title: See Who Has Viewed or Responded to Your Facebook Event Invite

steps.title: Facebook no longer tells you when someone sees your invite.
steps.content: Facebook no longer tells you when someone sees your invite. It used to be possible to see whether someone you invited to an event had seen the invite, even if they hadn't responded yet. At some point in 2023, Facebook removed this feature. While you can't see if someone viewed the event anymore, you can still see whether they're going, are interested, or can't go as long as they've RSVPed. It can be easy to miss an event invitation. If your friend hasn't RSVP'd to an event yet, you might want to message them to let them know you've invited them.

steps.title: Click Events on the left navigation panel.
steps.content: Click Events on the left navigation panel. If you're using a computer, you'll usually see this option in the left panel. If you don't see the Events option, click See More at the bottom of the EXPLORE menu. If you're not automatically logged into Facebook on your browser, enter your email or phone and your password to log in.

steps.title: Click Your Events.
steps.content: Click Your Events . A list of options will expand below. You'll also see the events you're going to, and have been invited to, in the right panel.

steps.title: Select an event.
steps.content: Select an event. Click any event in the right panel, or click Hosting in the left panel to view only the events you're hosting.

steps.title: Check the Guest List.
steps.content: Check the Guest List. At the bottom-right, you'll see the count of attendees who've marked themselves as Going , Maybe , or Can't Go . [1] X Research source Click See all , then click Going to see who RSVP'd that they are going to the event. Click Maybe or Interested to see if they've selected one of those options.
